question: In which of the following situations the right to Freedom of Speech in India may be restricted?
option1: If the freedom is used to incite people to violence
option2: If the freedom is used to Propagate nationalization of the private sector
option3: If the freedom is used to Level charges of corruption against those in power
option4: If the freedom is used to Spread superstition
answer: If the freedom is used to incite people to violence
explanation: The right to Freedom of Speech in India may be restricted, if the freedom is used to Incite people to violence. Sections 292 to 294 of the Indian Penal Code provide instances of restrictions on the freedom of speech and expression in the interest of decency or morality. These sections prohibit the sale or distribution or exhibition of obscene words, etc. in public places.
